examples.title:
Persistent
  bottom bar offering “Accept All / Manage Cookies”. Clear hierarchy &
  secondary panel for granular control.
examples.use_case:
Large
  media sites targeting both EU & global visitors.
examples.why_selected:
Demonstrates
  balanced default (non‑essential cookies disabled) and quick access to
  detailed settings.
examples.nielsen_heuristics:
Visibility
  of system status; User control & freedom

examples.title:
Modal
  overlay blocks content until a choice is made; includes vendor list via
  “Cookie Preferences”.
examples.use_case:
Subscription
  news behind paywalls—needs clear legal basis before personalization.
examples.why_selected:
Good
  example of lawful necessity explanation plus preference centre.
examples.pbd_alignment:
Privacy
  as default, Respect for user privacy

examples.title:
Full‑width
  header banner with “Yes, I’m happy” & “Manage my cookies” CTA plus
  summary of purposes.
examples.use_case:
Ad‑supported
  EU publisher requiring explicit consent.
examples.why_selected:
Progressive
  disclosure & minimal space impact on reading flow.

examples.title:
Centre‑screen
  dialog: tiered choices “Accept”, “Reject non‑essential”, “Customize”.
examples.use_case:
Airlines
  collecting PNR, location, & payment data.
examples.why_selected:
Illustrates
  compliant, multi‑action banner for sensitive personal data.

examples.title:
Simple
  banner with “Accept analytics cookies / Reject” + link to full policy.
examples.why_selected:
Uses
  plain language & immediate opt‑out to model best practice.

examples.title:
Layered
  page with high‑level summary bullets, expandable accordions, and topical
  navigation sidebar.
examples.use_case:
Global
  hardware & services provider balancing legal depth with consumer
  readability.
examples.why_selected:
Demonstrates
  progressive disclosure and visual hierarchy for dense policy text.
examples.pbd_alignment:
Visibility, Privacy
  embedded, Respect for user privacy
examples.nielsen_heuristics:
Recognition
  rather than recall; Aesthetic & minimalist design

examples.title:
Searchable
  hub with context‑specific sub‑pages (Windows, Edge, Xbox) and inline
  iconography.
examples.use_case:
Large
  multi‑product ecosystem needing granular but unified notice.
examples.why_selected:
Illustrates
  modular policy architecture to support varied data practices.

examples.title:
One‑screen
  overview (“Privacy in a nutshell”) with links to shortened product notices
  and translations.
examples.use_case:
Non‑profit
  browser & advocacy org emphasising transparency.
examples.why_selected:
Clear,
  plain‑language copy and human‑centric tone sets bar for readability.

examples.title:
Accordion
  sections + right‑column sticky nav + contextual tooltips.
examples.use_case:
Marketplace
  handling seller & buyer PII plus payment data.
examples.why_selected:
Good
  example of e‑commerce policy optimised for mobile reading via collapsible
  sections.

examples.title:
Region‑specific
  selector with simplified FAQs and illustrative icons.
examples.use_case:
Retailer
  with distinct regional legal regimes (GDPR vs. CCPA).
examples.why_selected:
Shows
  geolocation‑aware notice that adapts to local law and language.
